page.title: 17The Railway,Slyne-with-Hest.
page.content: The railway running through Slyne-With-Hest is the main west coast route from London to Glasgow. This line is electrified by overhead cables and enables passengers to travel from Lancaster to London in just over 3 hours.There is no station in Hest Bank now -it was closed in the 1960's.However,there is a busy level crossing and signal box at Hest Bank- allowing motorists to drive across the railway onto the shore.Local services using the railway line through Slyne-With-Hest go from Lancaster to Barrow ;to Windemere ;and via Carnforth to Leeds.Passengers travelling by train through Slyne-With-Hest pass within metres of Morecambe Bay and are able to get a panoramic view of the Lakeland hills.
